Notes: Not operated by T-Mobile, except for CMA629 in SC after the acquisition of SunCom. Competitor 850 MHz networks are accessible via roaming agreements.
Not operated by T-Mobile. After the failed acquisition of T-Mobile USA by AT&T, part of the failed acquisition was a 7-year AT&T 3G roaming agreement.

Most of this spectrum will be upgraded to 4G/LTE networks in the next two years.  (More Details See 4G LTE Upgrade) It is unclear if that means this network will be decommissioned anytime soon, but it is possible.
Has marketed 3G HSPA+ as \4G\" since 2011. Covers 230 million+ POPs as of March
